docs.snippet: If you are not a Wilhelm Steinitz or a Tigran Petrosian, it is best to stay out of cramped positions--for most of us, they are too hard to play....

docs.snippet: FOR Michael Rohde, the Manhatan Chess Club international tournament proved to be a marvelous opportunity. By scoring 9 points in 15 rounds, the  16-year-old New Jersey player not only tied for fifth place, but also achieved his first international...
docs.lead_paragraph: FOR Michael Rohde, the Manhatan Chess Club international tournament proved to be a marvelous opportunity. By scoring 9 points in 15 rounds, the 16-year-old New Jersey player not only tied for fifth place, but also achieved his first international master norm.

headline.main: CHESS; Michael Rohde: Another Bobby Fischer?
